NARRATIVE-CM:
The Argentine ship Monte Protegido was sunk by a German submarine on April 14, 1917. Argentina demanded an apology from Germany, and Germany agreed to provide an apology. Two Argentine merchant ships were sunk by German submarines. Argentina demanded compensation from Germany on August 5, 1917, and Germany agreed to the demand on August 28, 1917. The Argentine ship Victoria was damaged by a German submarine in April 1942, and the Argentine ship Rio Tercero was sunk by a German submarine in June 1942. Argentina severed diplomatic relations with Germany on January 26, 1944. Argentina declared war against Germany on March 27, 1945.

SOURCES-CM:
Sources: Keesing, November 10-17, 1945; Robertson, 1943, 212-237.
